content.rendered:
Photo via Unsplash

This Week in Genesis I’m humming with excitement to share the latest goings on in the WordPress Genesis community including new themes in the works from Calvin Koepke and Brian Gardner, Bill Erickson on scaling your freelance business, plus working with Genesis and the WordPress REST API.

Themes

First up this week, the Genesis legend that is Calvin Koepke is back working on more free Genesis themes for you, you lucky people…

It's about time to start on a new #genesiswp theme for all you good people to download. Of course, it'll turn into a personal redesign. ?

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) September 20, 2016

…and here’s a sneak peek.

Back to designing free #genesiswp themes again… https://t.co/5QDX4lokof #deseign pic.twitter.com/JRjdw7OWGy

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) September 21, 2016

And Brian Gardner’s also on the case with an update on the latest theme design he’s working on.

Working on a new theme design —> https://t.co/GWemEeZJAz #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) September 21, 2016

And finally in themes, I didn’t have the chance to even download it yet as it came out just before I hit Publish, but there’s a new, free Genesis theme from Riot! Customs called Simply Noted you might want to check out.

Grab this free #GenesisWP theme Simply Noted https://t.co/HXkv16CiW0 pic.twitter.com/4MDuihvNnG

— Riot! Customs (@RiotCustoms) September 23, 2016

Showcase

Some fantastic sites in the showcase this week, starting with this one from Rachael Kay Albers for justvibehouston.com

Have you checked out our NEW #genesiswp site that @RachaelKAlbers from RKA Ink designed? https://t.co/WNZVEgTXYO pic.twitter.com/Pm0FfwIWCF

— Just Vibe Houston (@JustVibeHouston) September 17, 2016

Matt Whiteley for kawalleyesonice.com

Latest project launch – https://t.co/ZLKvKDm7E2 – proudly hosted on @creativepxmedia #genesiswp #studiopress #wordpress

— Matt Whiteley (@whiteleydesigns) September 21, 2016

Nice one page site from Pilcrow Pixel for pbpartners.org.uk

A new one-page #genesiswp site for PB Partners, experts in Participatory Budgeting: https://t.co/AbOAXpdt4a

— Pilcrow + Pixel (@PilcrowPixel) September 21, 2016

Jean-Philippe with a cool site for super-commuter.com

Just launched a new #genesiswp website for a great startup aiming to help #supercommuters: https://t.co/7UprOK7aez pic.twitter.com/vDXVgZ4226

— Jean-Philippe (@jpmarchand) September 22, 2016

Liquid Moon with a one page site for albastone.co.uk

After a bit of a break, here's a one page site just launched https://t.co/iy0a0kFRyO #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/ChoQQOXXmk

— Liquid Moon (@liquidmoon) September 19, 2016

Mike Hemberger for parisischool.com

We launched https://t.co/6wyH9fmhCy recently, with a custom, franchise (location) management system built-in. They are loving it! #genesiswp

— Mike Hemberger (@JiveDig) September 20, 2016

Omar Al-Ansari for qpa.qa

Finally finished from https://t.co/H5NdZTAo3T and it's picked up in the news. #genesiswp https://t.co/I8EIxVSOKU

— Omar Al-Ansari (@oalansari82) September 22, 2016

And last, but definitely not least, Tony Eppright (with design by Hollis Anne) for chrisreining.com

Our latest #genesiswp website launched, https://t.co/djPa77EbXW …awesome design by Hollis Anne https://t.co/NwOqFyaMt8 #WordPress pic.twitter.com/a9M1QsKI9i

— Tony Eppright (@_AlphaBlossom) September 22, 2016

Podcasts

The most excellent Bill Erickson is the latest guest on the StudioPress.fm this week with plenty of sage advice on how to scale a freelance business. One not to miss.

New on StudioPress FM: How to Scale a Freelance Business — https://t.co/fppXrMMfjP #genesiswp with @BillErickson pic.twitter.com/J6s1GXnHvZ

— StudioPress (@studiopress) September 21, 2016

Best of the rest

If you’re intersted in getting your hands dirty with the WordPress REST API and Genesis, check out part 3 of Nate Finch’s Genesis and Angular tutorial series (and, if like me, you missed parts 1 and 2, check them out too).

Genesis and Angular: Adding Routing to Posts and Pages (Part 3) | All The Things… https://t.co/9UBt1lZ4iF #genesiswp #angular

— Nate Finch (@n8finch) September 19, 2016

Sridhar on how to use a custom template for specific category archives in Genesis.

How to use a custom template for specific category archives in Genesis:https://t.co/itOlhxuJM9#GenesisWP

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) September 17, 2016

That man Neil Gee with another handy tutorial, this time on adding a centered horizontal submenu in Genesis.

Adding a centered horizontal submenu in #GenesisWP Theme https://t.co/oxajMHvBGm

— Neil Gee (@_neilgee) September 20, 2016

BobWP with a handy reminder on hiding the page title when using Genesis using Bill Erickson’s Genesis Title Toggle plugin.

Hiding the Page Title When Using the Genesis Framework Easily https://t.co/GReTOkwEQs #WordPress #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/wOCPCn4n6D

— BobWP (@bobWP) September 22, 2016

And finally…

Sending a shout out to Rian Rietveld. Genesis contributor, accessibility extrodinare, and new team member over at Human Made.

We’re thrilled to welcome WordPress Engineer Rian Rietveld (@RianRietveld) to Human Made.

????https://t.co/WSDHTBEWpc

— Human Made (@humanmadeltd) September 20, 2016

excerpt.rendered: New themes in the works from Calvin Koepke and Brian Gardner, Bill Erickson on scaling your freelance business, plus working with Genesis and the WordPress REST API.
